intro: Pavetta dolichosiphon, commonly known as the long-siphon pavetta, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are typically borne in clusters at the leaf axils. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. Pavetta dolichosiphon is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
